alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued October 21 at 4:33AM MDT until October 23 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 10 inches possible. Higher amounts up to one foot above 6000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. Snow accumulations of a trace to 2 inches are possible at lower elevations including Polebridge. * WHERE...West Glacier Region, Highway 2 over Marias Pass, Glacier National Park. * WHEN...From late Friday night through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
